channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024072365
item.description:
Report X-2024072365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-05T15:15:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver brought the package back to the station after coding it a 7. DG Nav specialist was doing van pickups and noticed some wet corrosion on the FEC label. One jerrican leaked from loose cap.

  • Description: Driver placed a code 10 on the package and had it removed from the van. QA admin placed a code 39 on it, put the package in a lined tote, and brought it to the damage area. Two of four bottles leaked small amounts due to loose caps.

item.title: Report X-2024071634
item.description:
Report X-2024071634

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-04
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No-spill unprocessed hazmat. Package contains two bottles of UN1992 and two bottles of UN1993. The package is marked with UN1992, Flammable liquids, toxic, n.o.s. (Methanol) but has no diamond or LQ mark. It does not have shipping papers, certification, or a hazmat barcode. A sticky liquid from an outside source leaked onto the box, but all contents are undamaged.
